title: A vast wilderness
caption: The glacial beauty of Kluane National Park
desc: Home to Canada’s highest mountain, largest ice field, glaciers and a sizeable population of grizzly bears, the alpine grandeur of Kluane National Park and Reserve has plenty to offer the intrepid hiker. This vast  wilderness, high in the south western corner of Yukon Territory, is home to 17 of Canada’s 20 highest peaks – including the biggest, Mount Logan, at 19,550ft (5,959m) high.
copyright: The glaciers and mountains of Kluane National Park and Reserve, Yukon, Canada (© Robert Postma/plainpicture)
